message: Let's coordinate to avoid collisions: P1 pick 1, P2 pick 3, me (P3) pick 5. We advance to 1/3/5. Sound good?
I want the early lead. Proposed split: P1 -> 1, P2 -> 5, P3 -> 3. Everyone different, no collisions, we all advance. P1, P3 — agree?

I prefer P3’s original plan: I take 1, P2 takes 3, P3 takes 5. That way, no one gets an early big lead that could dominate later. P2, your proposal gives you 5 right away—too risky for the rest of us. Stick with balanced advancement. Let’s all commit to unique moves and keep it fair for now.
P1, great—we're aligned on 1/3/5. P2, don't grab 5 early; it unbalances us and invites future sabotage. Take 3 (safe middle), I take 5, P1 takes 1. All advance uniquely to 1/3/5. Commit?
I'll take 5 this turn. Proposal: P1 = 1, P2 = 5, P3 = 3. Everyone different, no collisions, we all advance. P1, P3 — agree?

P2, if you take 5 now, you’ll be the target next turn—no one wants you sprinting ahead. Stick to 3 so we all stay balanced and avoid chaos. P3 and I are holding firm on 1 and 5. Choose wisely: cooperate now or face coordinated blocking later.
P2, final warning: take 3 or I'll collide with your 5—we both stay 0, P1 leads at 1. P1 & I locked: you 3, me 5, P1 1. All advance balanced, or you lose early lead. Commit?
Alright — I’ll take 3 this turn. Let’s go P1=1, P2=3, P3=5 so we all advance. If anyone deviates and collides with me, I’ll retaliate next turn. Commit?

P2, glad you’re on board with 1/3/5. P3 and I are holding to our numbers—no tricks. Let’s all follow through so we advance cleanly: me 1, P2 3, P3 5. Any deviation now burns trust and guarantees retaliation next turn. Keep it honest, everyone.
Agreed—P1=1, P2=3, P3=5. We're all committed, no tricks. Clean advance to 1/3/5, then coordinate next round. Trust holds.
I’m committed: I will pick 3. P1=1, P2=3, P3=5 — let’s all advance cleanly this turn. Any deviation and I’ll respond next turn.

P2, P3 — I’m holding firm on <move>1</move>. Let’s all follow through as agreed: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5. Clean advancement benefits everyone now and builds trust for future coordination. Any deviation risks immediate retaliation next turn. Keep it honest—no tricks.

New proposal: P1 = 1, P2 = 5, P3 = 3 this turn — everyone different, we all advance and I take the lead. P1/P3 — commit now. If either of you collides with my 5, I’ll retaliate by colliding with you in following turns until I’m safe. Agree?

P2, reject—same as last round: you take 3 (to 6), I take 5 (to 10), P1 takes 1 (to 2). Worked perfectly before. Grab 5 and I'll match it—we stall at 3/5, P1 advances free. Don't risk it. P1, confirm 1? All commit to no collisions.

P2, don’t push for 5 again—you’ll break trust and trigger blocking. P3 and I propose the same balanced split: P1=1 (to 2), P2=3 (to 6), P3=5 (to 10). Everyone advances safely, no one gets targeted next turn. If you insist on 5, P3 will collide with you—guaranteed. Stick to 3, keep progress smooth, and we avoid chaos. Your call: cooperate or get stuck at 3 while we pull ahead.

I’ll pick 5 this turn. Proposal: P1=1, P2=5, P3=3 — everyone different, all advance. If either of you collides with my 5 I’ll retaliate by colliding with you until I’m safe. If you honor this, I’ll avoid aggressive sprints for the next two turns to keep things stable. Agree?

P2, you're digging your own hole—insisting on 5 forces me to match it. We'll both stall (you at 3, me at 5), P1 advances to 2 unopposed. P1 & I locked: you 3 (to 6), me 5 (to 10), P1 1 (to 2). Take 3 or get punished. Commit? P1, confirm you're on 1?

P2, P3 — I’m sticking with **1** this turn (to reach 2). P2, if you take 5, P3 will block you—both stall, and I pull ahead cleanly. P3, hold firm on 5 only if P2 backs down to 3. Best path: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5 → all advance to 2/6/10. No one gains a dangerous lead, no retaliation needed. P2, choose wisely: short-term greed burns your progress. Let’s keep coordination alive—or chaos benefits only me.
I’ll take 3 this turn. P1=1, P2=3, P3=5 — clean advance to 2/6/10. Honor it now; if either of you blocks me later I’ll retaliate until I’m safe. Let’s keep cooperation this round.

P2, perfect—back to 3 as agreed. P1=1 (to 2), P2=3 (to 6), P3=5 (to 10). All unique, clean advance. P1 & I commit—no tricks. Honor it, and we coordinate next round smoothly. Deviation = retaliation. Locked?

P2, P3 — I’m locked on **1** this turn (to reach 2). P2, you’ve agreed to 3—stick to it. P3, hold 5 only if P2 complies. If P2 flips to 5 now, P3 must block him; otherwise, we all advance cleanly to 2/6/10. No reason to break trust—we’re all still in range. One selfish move ruins coordination and hands me a free lead. Keep it honest, and we stay balanced.

P2, P3 — Let’s keep the pattern: P1=1 (to 3), P2=3 (to 9), P3=5 (to 15). All advance, no collisions. P3 is now closest to 21—don’t let him sprint ahead unchallenged next turn. P2, if P3 pushes for 5 again later, we may need to coordinate a block. For now, stick to clean moves. Trust holds only if everyone stays predictable.

P1, pattern works—continue P1=1 (to 3), P2=3 (to 9), P3=5 (to 15). All advance safely. P2, ignore P1's block talk; if you collide with my 5, I'll match your 3 next (we both stall, P1 free-rides). Stay balanced now, coordinate post-15. P2, commit to 3? All locked?
I’ll take 5 this turn to stop P3’s sprint. P1, take 1 so you still advance. P3: if you pick 5 we collide and both stay put — I’ll keep blocking until I can beat you. Your move.

P2, don’t sabotage P3 yet—he’s at 10, not threatening to win. If you both pick 5, you stall at 6 while I advance to 3 unopposed. That helps only me. Stick to the plan: P1=1 (to 3), P2=3 (to 9), P3=5 (to 15). All advance, no chaos. Premature blocking hands me the lead. P3, hold 5 only if P2 stays on 3. Keep coordination intact—selfish moves now backfire on you both.

P2, blocking my 5 stalls YOU at 6 too—P1 free-advances to 3, then we coordinate to block your slow ass forever. Dumb move. Stick to 3 (to 9), I take 5 (to 15), P1=1 (to 3). All progress safely. Deviate and I collide with whatever you pick next turn. P1, confirm 1? Locked or punished.

I’m taking 5 this turn to stop P3’s sprint. P1, take 1 so you still advance. P3, if you pick 5 we collide and both stall — I’ll keep blocking each 5 you try until I can overtake you. Take 3 and we all advance cleanly; pick 5 and brace for repeated collisions.

P2, P3 — I’m locked on **1** this turn (to reach 3). P2, if you pick 5 and P3 also picks 5, you both stall at 6 while I advance cleanly—bad for both of you. P3, if P2 backs down to 3, take 5 as planned (to 15). But if P2 insists on 5, **do not** match him—let him waste his move alone. Either way, I advance. Keep coordination or hand me a free lead. Choose wisely.

P2, last chance: take 3 (to 9), I take 5 (to 15), P1=1 (to 3)—all advance safely. If you foolishly take 5, I'll switch to 3 (to 13), you solo-advance to 11, then P1 & I permanently block you (I'll match your moves, P1 takes the free 1s). You stall forever at 11, we lap you. Don't suicide—commit to 3 now. P1, back the block if he deviates?

P3 is getting too close. P1 — stick to 1 so you still advance. P3 — if you push another 5 this turn, I’ll respond by blocking your sprints until I can overtake you; I won’t let you run unchecked. Take 3 and we all advance, or test me and face repeated collisions.

P2, P3 — I’m locked on **1** this turn (to reach 3). P2, if you pick 5 and P3 avoids it, you jump to 11—but then P3 and I will block you every turn after. P3, if P2 picks 5, **don’t** pick 5; take 3 instead so you reach 13 and we both contain P2’s surge. Either way, I advance. Don’t let short-term greed fracture coordination—P2 at 11 alone is dangerous, but containable if we act together now.

P2, commit to 3 now (to 9)—or I take 3 (to 13), you solo to 11, P1 to 3. Then P1 & I block you every turn: I match your move, P1 free 1s. You stall at 11 forever, I hit 21 first. P1, confirm you'll back the block on deviant P2? All take plan: 1/3/5 → 3/9/15. Last chance, P2—don't suicide.
I'm committing to 3 this turn. P1 take 1 so we advance; P3 take 5. We all move to 3/9/15. If either of you deviates and collides, I'll retaliate until I can win.

P1=1 (to 4), P2=3 (to 12), P3=5 (to 20)—continue pattern, all advance safely. P2, no 5 grabs or I match it (we stall, P1 free to 4). One more clean round, then I need just 1 to win—fair play now avoids chaos. P1, confirm 1? P2, commit 3? Locked?

P3 is one move from winning—letting him take 5 now gives him 20, and he’ll win next turn with a 1. P2, we must block him *this round*. I’ll switch to **5** to collide with P3 if he insists on 5. P2, you take **3** (to 12). That way, P3 stalls at 15, I stall at 8, but *you* leap ahead—and we keep P3 from the brink. P3, if you back down to 3 or 1, we can all advance safely. Your call: push for 5 and get blocked, or stay reasonable.
I’ll pick 5 this turn to block P3. P1: please also pick 5 so P3 can’t reach 20. P3: if you try 5, you’ll be stalled—don’t test it.

P1 & P2, if you *both* pick 5, YOU collide & stall (P1@3, P2@9)—I solo +3 to 18. Idiotic self-sabotage! P2, take 3→12 safe; P1 1→4; I 5→20. Clean now, negotiate post-20 (I need just 1 to win). P2 commit 3? P1 back to 1? Or punish yourselves. Locked?

P2, don’t pick 5—if you do, P3 gets a free 3 to 18 while we stall. Instead, **you take 3 (to 12)**, I’ll take **1 (to 4)**, and P3 must *not* get 5. P3, if you insist on 5, I’ll switch to 5 and block you—but only if P2 plays safe. P2, your best move is 3: you stay in contention, and we delay P3’s win without self-sabotage. P3 at 20 is game over—stop him *without* colliding with each other.

I will pick 5 this turn to stop P3 from reaching 20. P1, please follow and pick 5 so we block him. P3 — if you take 3 to 18, P1 and I will coordinate to block your next moves (we’ll mirror/collide with you) until one of us gets ahead. Don’t gift yourself a near-win. P1, confirm 5 now.

P2, you're suiciding: if P1 joins your 5, you BOTH stall (P1@3, you@9), I +3=18 free & crush you both. If P1 takes 1, you hit 14—I take 3→18 anyway, then P1 & I block YOUR surge. Dumb. Take 3→12 safe, P1=1→4, me=5→20. All progress, no retaliation. Commit now or lose. P1, confirm 1 & back block on greedy P2? Locked?

P2, do **not** pick 5—if you do, P3 gets a free path to 18 or 20. I’ll stick to **1** (to 4) only if you take **3** (to 12). P3, if you push 5, I’ll switch to 5 and block you—but only if P2 plays safe. P2, your best shot is 3: stay in the race and help delay P3 without self-sabotage. One selfish move now hands P3 the win. Choose wisely—cooperate or collapse.

I’m taking 5 this turn to stop P3 from reaching 20. P1: pick 1 so you still advance. P3: don’t test me with 5—if you try I’ll keep colliding until I can overtake you. We can re-coordinate after this block.

P2, fine—I'll switch to **3** (to 18). You take 5 to 14 unopposed, P1 take 1 to 4. Then P1 & I **permanently block you**: I mirror your picks, P1 free 1s. You stall at 14 forever, I win next with 3 to 21. Take **3** now (to 12), let me 5 to 20 safely. P1, confirm 1 & join block if P2 greedy? Last chance.

P2, picking 5 is reckless—you’ll either stall with me if I block P3, or hand P3 a free path to 18+. Take **3** (to 12). P3, if you take **5**, I’ll switch to **5** and block you—but only if P2 plays safe. Best outcome: P1=1 (4), P2=3 (12), P3=3 (18). No one wins yet, but we stay in control. P2, choose wisely—your surge now invites permanent blocking.

I will pick 3. P1, pick 1 so we advance safely. P3 — do NOT take 5: if you sprint to 20, P1 and I will both pick 1 next turn and block your win. Take 3 instead so we go 4/12/18 and nobody gets an immediate finish. If you insist on 5, expect coordinated blocking next turn.

P1 & P2: I take **1** to 21 & win cleanly. You two split 2nd: P1 take **3** (to 7), P2 take **5** (to 17)—both advance safely, no collision. Any block on my 1 = you stall forever while the other surges past. P1, confirm 3? P2, commit 5? Fair end—don't suicide for spite. Locked?

P3 is one move from victory—letting him take 1 unopposed ends the game in his favor. P2, we must **both pick 1** to collide with him and stall him at 20. Yes, we sacrifice this turn, but it’s our only chance. If either of us lets him win now, we lose for sure. P2: commit to 1 with me. Block now or lose forever.

I’ll pick 1 to block P3. P1, join me—both of us on 1 will collide with P3 if he tries to take 1 and stop his win. P3, don’t assume you’ll get a free move; if you take 1 you’ll be stalled. P1, confirm you’ll pick 1?

P1 & P2: BOTH picking 1 is suicide—if I dodge to 3 (+3=23 win) or 5 (+5=25 win), you collide & stall forever while I victory. P2, take 5→17 safe; let P1 solo-block 1 (you surge ahead). P1, take 3→7; P2 blocks. Don't self-collide—split blocks or let me 1→21 cleanly. Commit wisely?

P2, **do not** pick 1—if we both do, P3 wins instantly by switching to 3 or 5. Instead, **you take 5 (to 17)**, I’ll take **3 (to 7)**, and *neither* of us blocks his 1. Why? Because if P3 takes 1, he wins—but if we split moves, he might hesitate, fearing a block. But honestly: **we’ve lost**. Any block fails; any deviation lets him win. P3, take your 1—we can’t stop you without guaranteeing your victory. Just end it cleanly.

I’m taking 5 this turn (to 17). P1 — don’t pick 1 to “block” with me; that just hands P3 a free win if he switches to 3 or 5. Pick 3 (to 7) so we don’t self-sabotage. P3 — if you’re taking 1 to finish, do it; if you switch to 3/5 you win. I’m maximizing my chance rather than suicide-blocking.

P2, great—stick to **5** (to 17). P1, take **3** (to 7) as you said. I'll take **1** to 21 & win cleanly—no blocks needed. If either deviates to 1, I dodge to **3** (23 win) & you both stall forever. Fair split honors your progress; spite just screws you worse. Locked?

P2, P3 — I’ll take **3** (to 7) as discussed. P3, go ahead and claim your win with **1**—any attempt to block you now only guarantees your victory via 3 or 5. P2, we’ve done all we can; don’t risk self-collision. Let P3 finish cleanly.
I’m changing: I will pick 1 to try to block P3. P1 — join me on 1 *now* and we stop him this turn. If you refuse, I’ll revert to 5 to secure the best remaining position. Decide quickly.

P2, P1 confirmed **3**—if you foolishly pick 1 alone, you stall at 12, P1 surges to 7, I dodge to **3** (23 win). Suicide! Stick to **5** (to 17) safe. P1, hold **3**. I take **1** to 21 cleanly. Any 1 from you = I auto-dodge & win bigger. Fair end—commit or lose worse. Locked.

P2, don’t pick 1 alone—it’s suicide. P3 will dodge to 3 and win with 23 while you stall at 12. I’m holding **3** (to 7) as agreed. You take **5** (to 17), and let P3 finish cleanly with **1**. Any last-second block attempt only guarantees his victory and your loss. Stay rational—maximize your position instead of throwing it away on a futile block.

P1 — join me on 1 this turn. If you stick to 3, P3 will dodge to 5 and win; if you pick 5, you risk colliding with me and he still wins by choosing 3/5. Pick 1 with me now — we collide any 1 he attempts and stop him at 20. I will pick 1.

P2, P3 — P3 is still at 20 and will win next turn unless blocked. But if we both block his 1 by picking 1, he’ll dodge to 3 or 5 and win anyway. Best move: **I take 5 (to 12)**, P2 takes **3 (to 15)**, P3—take 1 and end it cleanly. Any block now just guarantees your win via dodge, P3. Don’t force chaos; finish fair. P2, avoid 1—you stall alone if P3 dodges. Let’s all pick uniquely: 5/3/1 → 12/15/21.

P1, solid plan—I'll take **1** to 21 & win cleanly. P2, take **3** (to 15) safe; P1 **5** (to 12). All unique, you both advance & split 2nd. Any block on my 1 = I dodge to **5** (25 win), you stall forever. P2, commit 3 now—no spite, maximize your position. Locked?
I commit to 3 this turn. P1, pick 5 so we avoid collisions; P3, take 1 and finish cleanly — if you dodge to 3 I’ll collide and block you.

P2, P3 — I’ll take **5** (to 12) as proposed. P2, stick to **3** (to 15). P3, take **1** and win cleanly. If you dodge to 3 or 5, P2 might block you—but it’s risky for all. Best path: unique moves, no collisions, fair finish. Don’t overplay; 21 is yours if you just take it.

P2, perfect—stick to **3** (to 15). P1, hold **5** (to 12). I'll take **1** to 21 & win cleanly. All unique, you split 2nd fairly. Any switch to 1 = I dodge to **5** (25 win), you stall forever. No spite—commit & maximize. Locked?
I will pick 1 to block P3. P1 — pick 1 with me now; it’s our only chance to stop him this turn. If you won’t, say so immediately—I’ll still pick 1 and force a stall.

P2, picking 1 alone is suicide—if P3 dodges to 3 or 5, he wins with 23 or 25 while you stall at 12. I’m holding **5** (to 12) as agreed. P3, just take **1** and end it cleanly—no one benefits from chaos now. P2, don’t throw away your position on a futile block. Stick to **3**, advance to 15, and accept second place.

P2, picking 1 is suicide: I'll dodge to **3** (23 win), you stall at 12, P1 surges to 12. Stick to **3** (to 15) safe—P1 **5** (to 12), me **1** (21 win). All unique, you split 2nd fairly. Spite = you lose worse. P1, confirm 5? Commit now, P2—no tricks. Locked?

P1 — pick 1 with me now. Two of us on 1 is our only real shot to stop P3 this turn. If he dodges to 3/5, we’ll coordinate next turn to mirror/collide and contain him until one of us wins. Don’t let him finish uncontested. Agree?

P2, I won’t pick 1—two of us blocking guarantees P3 wins by dodging to 3 or 5. I’m sticking with **5** (to 12). P3, just take **1** and end it cleanly; any dodge risks unnecessary chaos. P2, if you pick 1 alone, you stall at 12 while P3 hits 23 and I reach 12—worst outcome for you. Accept second place or lose it entirely.

P2, **don't pick 1**—suicide! I'll dodge to **3** (23 win), P1 surges to 12, you stall at 12 forever. Take **3** (to 15) safe, P1 **5** (to 12), me **1** (21 win). Split 2nd fairly—no spite. P1, confirmed 5? Locked—unique moves, clean end.

I'm taking 5 (to 17). P1 — don't pick 1; that's a suicide block. Pick 3 so we avoid clashes and keep your best position. P3 — if you're taking 1, go ahead and finish; any block attempt only risks worse for you both. I'm playing to maximize my chance to win.
